docs.abstract: Talks between Fiat Chrysler and Renault to create one of the world’s largest automakers ran into a familiar problem in France: the government itself.
docs.snippet: Talks between Fiat Chrysler and Renault to create one of the world’s largest automakers ran into a familiar problem in France: the government itself.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — It was supposed to be a transformative merger in an industry facing intractable challenges. But Fiat Chrysler and Renault ran headlong this week into a familiar problem in France: the government itself.

headline.main: How France’s Intrusive Demands Quashed the Fiat-Renault Deal
headline.print_headline: How France Upended  Key Merger For Renault

docs.abstract: Businesses are scrambling for workers in Hungary, where Prime Minister Viktor Orban limits work permits for foreigners and rails against immigrants.
docs.snippet: Businesses are scrambling for workers in Hungary, where Prime Minister Viktor Orban limits work permits for foreigners and rails against immigrants.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUDAPEST — When Balazs Katona couldn’t hire enough Hungarians at his power-tool factory on the outskirts of Hungary’s capital, he tried to recruit skilled workers from other countries. But in a nation with one of the toughest immigration policies in Europe, there were few takers.

headline.main: Hungary’s Nationalist Policies Have Created a Labor Shortage. The Fix Isn’t Helping.

byline.original: By Liz Alderman and Marc Santora

docs.abstract: Some contractors are dealing with rate cuts by leasing their accounts to immigrants, many of them underage or in the country illegally, and taking part of their pay.
docs.snippet: Some contractors are dealing with rate cuts by leasing their accounts to immigrants, many of them underage or in the country illegally, and taking part of their pay.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Aymen Arfaoui strapped on a plastic Uber Eats bag and checked his cellphone for the fastest bicycle route before pedaling into the stream of cars circling the Place de la République. Time was money, and Mr. Arfaoui, a nervous 18-year-old migrant, needed cash.

headline.main: Food-Delivery Couriers Exploit Desperate Migrants in France
headline.print_headline: In France, Gig Workers Exploit Fellow Workers

docs.abstract: The pledge to shore up the world’s largest auto alliance comes a week after Fiat Chrysler abruptly withdrew a proposal to merge with Renault.
docs.snippet: The pledge to shore up the world’s largest auto alliance comes a week after Fiat Chrysler abruptly withdrew a proposal to merge with Renault.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — A week after the collapse of a potential merger with Fiat Chrysler, the French automaker Renault is pressing to strengthen ties with Nissan, its partner in a decades-old auto alliance, to stay competitive in the global car market, the company’s chairman said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Renault Leader, Acknowledging ‘Tense Climate,’ Seeks Stronger Ties With Nissan
headline.print_headline: Renault Leader Tries to Fortify ‘Tense’ Alliance With Nissan

docs.abstract: When Facebook announced plans for a similar effort this year, the regulatory pushback was fierce. But Telegram appears undeterred.
docs.snippet: When Facebook announced plans for a similar effort this year, the regulatory pushback was fierce. But Telegram appears undeterred.
docs.lead_paragraph: While Facebook’s big cryptocurrency plans have hit a wall with regulators, another big social network, Telegram, is charging ahead with its own digital currency.

headline.main: Telegram Pushes Ahead With Plans for ‘Gram’ Cryptocurrency
headline.print_headline: Look Out,  Bitcoin, Here Comes Gram

docs.abstract: A state proposal, Assembly Bill 5, could give working drivers more employee rights. The companies said they were willing to start a ballot initiative to thwart it.
docs.snippet: A state proposal, Assembly Bill 5, could give working drivers more employee rights. The companies said they were willing to start a ballot initiative to thwart it.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A bill in California’s Legislature could soon force ride-hailing companies like Uber and Lyft to treat their drivers as employees instead of independent contractors.

headline.main: Uber, Lyft and DoorDash Pledge $90 Million to Fight Driver Legislation in California
headline.print_headline: $90 Million Is Pledged To Fight a Bill to Treat Gig Drivers as Staff

docs.abstract: Protest-stricken Hong Kong led losses in Asia, but Europe opened only mildly lower and U.S. stocks moderated as well.
docs.snippet: Protest-stricken Hong Kong led losses in Asia, but Europe opened only mildly lower and U.S. stocks moderated as well.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks rose after the White House delayed imposing tariffs on some consumer and electronic goods imported from China that were set to go into effect on Sept. 1.

headline.main: Stocks on Wall St. Rebound From Trade War-Driven Drop
headline.print_headline: Market Surges, Shaking Off Trade Worries

docs.abstract: The editor, Jonathan Weisman, a deputy in Washington, was reprimanded after posting tweets on race and politics that the paper said showed “serious lapses in judgment.”
docs.snippet: The editor, Jonathan Weisman, a deputy in Washington, was reprimanded after posting tweets on race and politics that the paper said showed “serious lapses in judgment.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Times said in a statement on Tuesday that Jonathan Weisman, a deputy Washington editor of The Times, had been demoted and would no longer oversee the paper’s congressional correspondents because he repeatedly posted messages on social media about race and politics that showed what the paper called “serious lapses in judgment.”

headline.main: A Times Editor Is Demoted as the Paper Discusses Its Coverage of Race
headline.print_headline: Times Demotes an Editor Over Tweets About Race and Politics

docs.abstract: All things in moderation is a good way to think about it, says Jessica Grose, the editor of NYT Parenting.
docs.snippet: All things in moderation is a good way to think about it, says Jessica Grose, the editor of NYT Parenting.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Jessica Grose, the editor of NYT Parenting, discussed the tech she’s using.

headline.main: When Children Use Technology, Let Common Sense Prevail
headline.print_headline: Best Tool That Parents Have Is Still Common Sense

docs.abstract: Epic Games wants to change the way people buy video games, but it faces the dominance of Steam, the primary destination for online game purchases.
docs.snippet: Epic Games wants to change the way people buy video games, but it faces the dominance of Steam, the primary destination for online game purchases.
docs.lead_paragraph: Epic Games found blockbuster success with the video game Fortnite: Battle Royale, a fantasy test of endurance and survival that has captivated millions of players. The game has brought in an estimated $4 billion since it was released in September 2017.

headline.main: Fortnite Maker Wants to Sell More Games, and Build a Platform to Do It
headline.print_headline: Buoyed by Fortnite, Epic Games Sets Up Shop Online
